reviews.sentence: Children not welcome here. Checked in the 26th Mar for 2 weeks and on arrival was told children can not use indoor pool between 12 pm and 6 pm and I will said to reception that is the first I have heard of that and he said they are the rules. I said to my elderly mother sure we can use outdoor pool but next day outdoor pool closed until may with an mantanance sign blocking entry. The following 3 days of complaining I finally met manager he apologised and cheekily offered us free Wi fi as compensation I laughed and he just walked away. Do not bring your family to this hotel it is a business hotel for 1 night stays. They do not cater for families we had to pay extra for the hilton spa so I would that hotel. Please do not make the same mistake I did.

Nice hotel. The hotel was good clean rooms enough space however the closet was quite small. we have had problems with the television set it run four days in a row out of order due to an internet problem. Rooms were cleaned very well although the amenities were not refilled and after three days sharing the body lotion and shampoo with my husband there was really no drop left to squeeze out. We had to ask for it while normally we are used to have it replaced automatically. The same for the tea in the room no refills unles you ask for it. The breakfast was excellent friendly courteous staff and a wide range of food. The hotel is good but somehow I had expected more from it.

Disappointed. Although I had reservation for delux sea view room I was told the agent made a mistake and received normal room. After 2 days because of the pressure of my agent I received executive sea view room. In both rooms they forgot to put some amenities and one day even 2 small towels. One day they forgot to clean the room. and after asking it took more than one hour until someone was sent. Even that we had late checkout which was confirmed on the day when we received the room and in the morning of the checkout. The hotel told us that it was the agent mistake and we had to leave the room early.

Go for Sea View. Arrived at the hotel at around noon and was told that I would have to wait until 2PM to get my room but that it would be worth the wait. Being the skeptical traveler that I am I was pleasantly surprised when I finally went up to the room. The room was spacious very spacious with the bathroom separate from the toilet and having a shower and a large sitting tub. As far as the condition of the room goes there were a few faults. Nothing that one can not find in other hotels at the same level but the maintenance chief needs to wake up and start doing his job. The room I think it was room 814 has a balcony with a sea view booked in advance and paid extra for only partially obstructed by another building. I have no idea how the other standard rooms are but it seems that some face the large parking lot and some may face an adjoining building that is quite close to the hotel. Breakfast was good. The only complaint is about the orange juice which has an odd taste and tastes nothing like fresh juice but otherwise there was a wide variety and of good quality. WiFi was available in the room free of charge but I think that is only true for the Deluxe rooms. To summarize the Le Meridien is very good but if you plan on staying at this hotel I would strongly recommend booking a Deluxe or Sea View room.

Nice hotel. Relatively to its class the hotel is nice. Probably there are better choices in the area but this is giving at the end a good cost performances. What in my opinion was positive. the location the rooms clealines and as already said pricing. On the negative side I think there are some of the typical holiday facilities for waht I was bale to see. the sea in front of the hotel it is not so convenient the swimming pool looks very small despite give a very nice sightseeing from the roof of the bay. What is average the breakfast the SPA and the common areas.

Nearly a five star but not quite. The hotel itself was fine. Our room was a good size clean and had a good bed which is crucial in my eyes. The balcony looked onto a wall so we obviously did not bother going on it so if you want to spend any time in your room I suggest you pay a bit more for a view. The location was not great there are much prettier places in Malta. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The indoor spa was fairly nice but the outdoor pool was a bit of a let down. One warning re Malta generally taxis are incredibly expensive. The hotel has a list of the prices that fares should be so check before you get charged 1520 euros for a 5 min drive. The bus from the airport usually stops next to the hotel according to the website but the roads were apparently closed when we were there and the unhelpful bus driver did not let us know. We ended up half way back to the airport before anyone realised and were left stranded waiting 40 mins for a cab. It would have been useful if the hotel had sent out an email to their guests staying during that time warning them of the road closures.

Brilliant holiday. Just returned from staying at Le Meridien for a week with my boyfriend. The hotel is in Baluta Bay which is only a short walk to St Julians and is in a busy popular area. We stayed on the 3rd floor and paid for room only we did not upgrade for a better view and therefore could only see palm trees and not much light. But the room was very large and the bathroom and bed was very spacious for just the two of us. The room was cleaned regularly and it was great to have AC available. Towels were provided by the pool area great rooftop area there were ample beds for people and there was a bar by the pool for refreshments. The gym was good and the concierge was very helpful during our stay. Free wifi in the lobby was also included. Spa facilities were also good sauna steam room indoor pool and towels for the pool were also given. Good transport links to Valetta and surrounding areas and also taxis were available if not slightly more expensive than a bus trip. There were some great restaurants near by but you may need to pre book for some depending on when you go. The only complaint I have is that it did not feel like 5 stars there was no kettle in the room and 2 of the lights did not work. I understand things can break. be missing but after having to ask on 3 separate occasions it got a bit tedious. I also felt that not all of the receptionists were fully committed to helping with queries. We were often stood at the downstairs bar waiting to be served and ended walking out after having not been asked our order the bar was not very busy at this time so I do not understand the reason for this. I was also informed by reception that we should be given complimentary bottled water in our room daily but this only happened on the last 2 days of our stay. I had love to go back to Malta and would stay at the hotel again but believe a few things could be changed for it to reflect a 5 star hotel.

Best 60th Birthday. The hotel is set just off the main road overlooking the bay with plenty of restaurants pubs and entertainment around perfect. We were made very welcome by the helpful and smiling staff. The layout of the spa swimming pool and the gym and the reception lobby was beautiful. Main purpose of our visit was to run my 60th marathon on my 60th birthday and staying at Le Meridien made it special. The hotel even catered for a very early breakfast for the runners on the marathon day. One improvement could be maintaining the pool and steam room temperature to acceptable level. Overall we could not have chosen a better place than Le Meridien.

Enjoyed staying. We stayed 4 nights. We enjoyed all aspects large room beautiful view of the bay the spa and indoor pool buffet breakfast and dinner good location with bus stop right outside the hotel. We were surprised how renovated is the hotel given past feedbacks we read in some of the 5 hotels in malta about poor state of the buildings. It is obvious they renovated recently including the hi tech elevators. We will return definitely.

Good enough hotel but nothing special. Good enough hotel but some of the areas are a little dated. The restaurant food is no good at all despite them trying to recreate a high end feel with table cloths and suit clad waiters. The food was way below average. I was really annoyed that when I checked in I was not asked for a credit card for them to secure any extras although my colleague was asked for one. They said I did not have to because of the way my reservation was booked so all OK. Then the next morning I went to have breakfast and when I finished they came with a bill and asked me to pay on the spot. I did not have my wallet with me of course so I asked if I could settle at check out. They said no because I had not given a credit card when I checked in so I had to pay then and there. That was bad communication and manners they should have asked my at check in to give them my card and not ask me to pay my breakfast on the spot. Some guests at check in were offered a refreshment we were not so not sure what their criteria for offering a juice is. The location is great and the rooms really big. Location is great Baluta bay just across the street. the main coastal road giving easy access to where you want to go. Staff attitude some touches like swimming pool bar having a nicer selection of drinks and snacks rather than just basic stuff. Restaurant food.
Great facilities and location. Rooftop pool and spa pool. Separate toilet in very corner of seaviewrom.
Best choice in Malta. it is the perfect place where professionalism quality and elegance blend beautifully well together.

Great Hotel Excellent condition. Not the first time me my family stayed at this hotel and it is always a pleasure. It has a brilliant location close to all amenities breathtaking views and great service. A special thanks goes to the concierge Mario Bugeja he is always very helpful professional and filled with passion towards his work. A hotel that is definitely suitable for all ages. The spa is definitely the best on the island it is a pity that children are not allowed between 12 6pm. The idea of having a few hours allocated only to adults is good but I strongly believe that from 12 6pm is too long. Overall one of the best hotels on the island. Will definitely visit again.

Wonderful Hotel. Really kind hotel staff checked us in quickly and efficiently. Huge room with a lovely balcony. Whole hotel was kept lovely and clean. One of my personal favorites touches was the touch screens you use to order the lift to you and which floor you wish to go to it then tells you which lift to use you jump in and it takes youMasive baths also and powerful shower. Bed must have been king size10 would stay here again.

Excellent location great breakfast good rooms rude receptionists. The good. The best thing about Le Meridien St Julian is it is location right in the Center and close to everything in St Julian. The breakfast was also great allot of fresh options. The rooms were a bit dated but ok. Conference facilities were decent. The bad The receptionists were some of the most unprofessional and rude that I have ever seen in my life in person or over the phone. Very dismissive and do not really care much for the hotel guests. I hope management invests in thier customer service training and skills which are ok for a two star hotel but not for a five star one.
Malta. The whole atmosphere of the hotel was fantastic. Everything was as we expected from a 5 star hotel very good.

This is an Awesome Hotel. My girl friend and I recently stayed at the Le Meridien in Malta for 4 days. It is about 25 minutes by cab from the airport and I was there for a 2 day conference so while I was working my girl friend was able to enjoy the spa the beautiful 12th floor pool deck and due to its location take leisurely walks around the beautiful seaside town of St Julians and enjoy the executive lounge for a tasty breakfast and happy hour with appetizers where I would join here after my conference ended. The food and drink options in the lounge were very nice. I am an SPG gold member and we were upgraded to an amazing 2 room sea view suite on the 11th floor with exec floor access at check in. The suite was very well appointed with super comfy bed a master bath with soaking tub and separate glass shower with rain shower head. The living room was large and the second full bath was very convenient as I had to get up at 630am to shower and head to the conference and I could do so with out disturbing my girl friend. Each room also had an really nice oversized balcony were one could just sit relax and soak in the amazing view. Our first night there we arrived a little late so we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant which in some cases can be average to disappointing but it ended up being one of the best meals we had there even after going out to close by recommended venues which were also excellent. The hotel staff was very nice helpful and went out of their way to make our stay there one of the best resort experiences we have had and I travel over 180 days every year.
Good place to stay in Malta. Clean rooms good service and I loved the spa area.
Great rooms and service.

BEST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN MALTA. It ’s located in such a convenient location between St Julians and Sliema and some of the rooms feature an incredible view over Baluta Bay and the homonymous church. Check my Instagram to see what I mean giusepecanavo. All the guests have free parking which means no more hassle to find it outside trough the extreme traffic of Malta. Breakfast was well made staff was super nice and the Spa much appreciated. Jamie and Chiara welcomed us during the check in and made us feel like home since the first step. We had the chance to try out also the Atrio restaurant at the 3rd floor where we had a wonderful dinner and an exclusive service from the waiter ManuelWith the well equipped 247 gym I was able to maintain my workout routine even during my holiday so that was a big plusOur room was very clean very silent and with the perfect temperature inside which made our sleep perfect. Wifi connection was on point as well. I am more than satisfied of my overall experience definitely something to repeat.
